intro: Tachiadenus trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined tachiadenus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Tachiadenus trinervis is notable for its ornamental value and its role in local ecosystems.
